Today is National Census Day!

Why is the census important for schools?

Census data is used to fund federal programs for schools. In California, over $7 billion in federal funding supports school programs such as: school nutrition, after school, special education, English Language Learners, Native American students, farm workers, youth experiencing homeless, and Head Start programs.

Why does your participation matter?

Your school district receives funding from Title I A Part Federal funds and Your participation matters. Counting all children, even those in preschool, is essential for California‚Äôs schools to receive their fair amount of funding.

New this year!

Filling out the census questionnaire is easier than ever. For the first time the census questionnaire is available online at www.census.gov. Of course you can still complete the questionnaire by mail, or over the phone.

What a great event! The 6th Annual STEM Career Day for 9th graders took place today. Over 1,200 students from 32 high schools across Northern California came together to learn about careers in Science, Technology, Engineering, & Math.

As students started their day, Professor Randy Reed, who teaches Earth Sciences at Shasta College shared about some of the learning experiences offered at Shasta College, including a Global Expeditions experience each summer. Brandy Greene, a graduate of Central Valley High School, shared about what she does as an Environmental Scientist who works for an engineering firm. She shared the importance of internships and the types of jobs and flexibility within this career field.

Students then had the opportunity to explore careers in two of the exhibition halls as well as compete in small groups in a wind challenge.

An event such as this takes an enormous amount of planning and many volunteers. I'm so thankful for all the businesses who came out to engage students and all the volunteers who made this event a reality!
